name: nyu
text: A comment left by nyu was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, Tambourine, tttt2)

name: soticoto
text:
Well, I'm seeing a good trip here.
I have no doubt that Onstad drawing a bad trip would leave us all mentally scarred for life, so it is probably just as well he doesn't.

... Duuuude... this is bringing me back to the time where I had a really bad trip and spent two hours just tying my shoe-laces (on one shoe) because my memory kept cutting out every 2 seconds and I'd forget what I was doing. I was hella terrified of everything, and just wanted to get my shoes on so I could run outside and escape. In the end I just collapsed on the kitchen floor with one shoe tied and closed my eyes until it all went away.

name: anzio
text: You had a bad trip on what? Weed? How do you do that?

name: soticoto
text: Canadian weed. Not sure if that was what did it, but it was quite different to the sort I was used to from back in Wales. Its effects were most unwelcome and made for a thoroughly unpleasant experience. It was quite strong, at that.

name: anzio
text: I can understand this. Canada has some good weed, usually.

name: soticoto
text: I will continue to maintain the polar opposite opinion until I receive evidence to the contrary.

name: anzio
text: What, do you think Canada has bad weed? Maybe in the east, but in the west, like British Columbia, the weed is considered quite fine.

name: soticoto
text: Fair enough, I suppose. I wouldn't know about BC.

name: alilsneaky
text: As far as I know thc is thc... the only difference from plant to plant being the amount of thc in it,growth rate and smell.

name: anzio
text: Yeah, I actually don't know how someone really has a bad trip on weed. I mean, sure, maybe you get so high that you black out and do a bunch of very stupid shit, like laugh ferociously at the laughter setting on a keyboard, or eat far too much of the host's food, but I've never had a 'bad' trip. Then again, I know people who say they have too, so it's probably possible.

name: soticoto
text:
Could be that the plants had been fed strange chemicals, or grown up under different conditions to scew the ratios of the right natural chems in them. Could have just been that there was more thc per volume than I was used to. Might not have been the weed itself at all, but due to the fact I was smoking it outside in Canada in the middle of winter. Who is to really say?


Fact was... weed I'd had before had generally just mellowed me and screwed with my balance before, but that particular case seriously screwed up my memory for an indeterminate amount of time.

name: anzio
text: Like for the duration of the high or for a time afterwards? I once had something like that happen to me where I could only remember maybe one thing from the whole night. I was told I ruined the party, and I believe them.

name: macaboi
text: How can you not love this?

name: antsama
text: A comment left by antsama was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ShemmJacc, doinkydoink, Cyberbob, TwoRightFeet, headphones, antecen, farqussus, aHatOfPig, Dwilow, clembot, Direhaggis, lastlarf, Pigs)

name: saint
text: i checked. they don't.

name: zem
text: L@@K INTO YOUR PAST

name: gompo
text: I don't think i've ever laughed as hard or as much at a single cut off line as I did and do at that.

name: hadakang
text: agreeing with this. stoned ray is hilarious ray. he's just so contemplative.

name: imbattin
text: A friend and I will text that to each other from time to time, for energy. For fun.

name: fuzzyshoo
text: Every time I come to this strip, I love seeing this comment. Avatar makes it. Chubby.

name: sredni
text: A comment left by sredni was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by wharfrat, straw, Tinhand, divot, phthoggos, Nurdbot, daidai, riotdejaneiro, Cyberbob, Overmedicated, VeniVidiEffluxi, equinn2006, TheLoneliestMonkey, mystkmanat, lazarusloafer, apres, Dainbramage, opalleye)

name: jokercross
text: A comment left by jokercross was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, divot, phthoggos, daidai, riotdejaneiro, Cyberbob, Overmedicated, VeniVidiEffluxi, equinn2006, TheLoneliestMonkey, mystkmanat, lazarusloafer, Direhaggis, apres, opalleye)

name: afastidioushat
text: It's the piece of driftwood that Ray wrote "The Cure" on to remind T about eternity.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: He is continuing to be reminded about eternity for more an entire odd conversation and 14 seconds of just looking at it.

name: petitegitan
text: Where the hell have you been!?

name: sredni
text: oh shit that was obvious haha shit my bad guys my bad

name: huber
text:
haha - camping is the ultimate form of habitation.

I'm gonna go into the garage and smell metal stuff. Instead.

name: epicurus
text: Those were my two favourite parts too.

name: chaesar
text: Very good, but I think his inquiry into eBay awards for blowing peoples' minds is the icing on this cake.

name: achilleselbow
text:
I'm not 100% sure about this, and no one is going to be reading this comment by now, but "expression of habitation" sounds very much like a particular concept from Heidegger's "Building, Dwelling, Thinking." Onstad has mentioned Foucault before so he must be at least familiar with this sort of stuff - I wonder if this was actually what was on his mind while he was writing the strip.

P.S. I only post this now because we just read the essay in class the other day.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Really. We wouldn't have guessed.

just playin'

name: atticusonline
text: it is wrong to assume that no one reads recent comments. personally, I read through every achewood comic from beginning to end (most recent) and then immediately go back and start from the beginning. I can do this because achewood never gets old .

name: poodlelucy
text: you have become my achewood role model. i aspire to read every strip and then go right back to the genesis of it all.

name: atticusonline
text: I wish you well on your journey of many twinkies and mountain dews.

name: poodlelucy
text: thank you, kind sir... although in my case it will be wasa crackers and tea.

name: atticusonline
text: I will allow this.

name: hereward
text: I wonder if Onstad did a humanities degree. I don't think this information is Known.

name: zapatos
text: I am sure someone Knows of it, namely Chris.

name: jstegall
text: The last two panels are so friggin' awesome. And the part about smelling metal stuff is awesome too... Okay, the whole strip is awesome.

name: jamers
text: I too enjoy Squeaking with my arms held aloft.

name: m1st3rbl4ck
text:
--->
SQUEAK

he looks so intent.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Lawnmowers do smell beautiful. Gasoline and grass clippings and metal all blended together in a metaphor for the meaningful life.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: They smell like the oppressive fist of the State to birds.

name: nurdbot
text: God, I love seeing the crazy stuff this cat does while he is on the pot. This and Hip Hobbit are my personal favourites.

name: charchar
text: I get my cat stoned and all it does is roll back and forth, speaking in tongues.

name: apocowarg
text:
Don't get your cat high. That is a silly thing to do. Your cat wants you to put food in its dish and maybe pet its tummy when it chooses to present said tummy. Only hippies and people who are kind of jerks force animals to be stoned.

There's a redundancy in that last sentence.

name: mangtastic
text: My dog got a contact high and every time I light up within his olfactory range he whines and makes it quite clear that he wishes to be present.

name: apocowarg
text: I was referring more to people who think it is awesome to hold an animal and blow smoke in its face. The key word is "force".

name: dinosaur-j
text:
Alt text:

I didn't look, but I don't think they currently do.

name: jesler729
text: Am I crazy, or did the alt text used to be something like "The cat got so high he tried to sell his lawnmower on ebay"?

name: numberkillinger
text:
that is the name of the strip.
you may also be crazy.

name: jesler729
text:
Oh.

Oh dear.

name: phthoggos
text: damn what is up with that clock

name: kazad
text: I THINK it's showing that Ray waited a full 15 seconds before replying...and Ray is outlined because he kind of forgot about himself...sort of invisible. Anyway, it makes sense to me looking back on similar experiences.

name: heccibiggs
text: I can totally relate to that. Responding to something someone said far later than is normally acceptable, because I've just gotten lost in my own train of thought. And then they're like, "What?", having completely forgotten abut the original subject.

name: deusoma
text: Damn, I thought it meant that 15 minutes had passed, though looking back, I doubt that T would still be interested in that ridiculous driftwood after 15 minutes unless he too was baked.

name: sp1derbaby
text:
Ray has just realised that time is an illusion and that he exists outside of it.

By the end of the strip, he has realised that time and space are the one concept and therefore he also exists outside space.

name: boheeka
text: The first time I got stoned, I thought that it was going to be nine o'clock forever .

name: tombsgrave
text: Ray   weed = brilliant!  It's a winning combination yet to be matched.

name: direhaggis
text: Thus the weed trilogy draws to a close. I appreciate driftwood and lawnmowers more. And Todd. I know him.

name: arcellus
text: can someone explain the clock in the 5th frame

name: mega_panda
text: I believe it is meant to indicate that fifteen seconds have passed.

name: gumfish
text:
Man, I just love how he squeaks off to the void, arms aloft, after writing on the grid.

It's like he's... Mr. Miracle

See him fly

name: shutup_shutup
text: I think he's imprinting himself on the grid.  But what is the grid?  The strip itself?

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Man, that West Coast chronic is clearly the bomb. Ray seems to verge on tripping in most of his "stoned" strips, despite being a habitual toker.

name: rowboat
text: Though Ray does have a crush on being high, I get the impression that he's not exactly a habitual "toker." He seems to depend on Teodor to smoke him out (which, being the multi-millionaire that he is, seems kind of shabby - but that's a story for another time). I don't care how good their stuff is over there, if you get stoned all the time, you stop acting like this eventually (unless it's laced with PCP, or something - but that's a story for another time). However, this is exactly what it's like to the occasional user, especially if the shit is "The Fire." This arc makes me jealous and nostalgic for the times when I was just starting out and even the shittiest Mexican brick weed (which was all there was, then) would send me into this sort of intense reverie for hours. Don't get me wrong - my love affair with weed continues. But my behavior is much closer to that of Teodor; definitely having a good time, but totally (and hopelessly) under control.

name: numberkillinger
text: yes

name: ford
text: It's like looking into my future...

name: arbys
text:
I love Teodor's response here.

"You can't go camping in the middle of your party. It's kinda rude."

name: denise
text: panel five is exactly me when i get stoned, i just never realised until now when ray showed me

name: brzbee
text: I love how Teodor's word bubble in panel two is kinda floating in the background. All in all, just a perfect representation of being stoned.

name: frankieteardrop
text: i would buy this lawnmower in a heartbeat.

name: wozzeck
text: It always uneases me, to see a man with a beautiful woman for an avatar.

name: heccibiggs
text: Like a really hot tranny?

name: wozzeck
text: An e-tranny? A cognitive transvestite, perhaps? It is like answering your door, to find on your doorstep a plain-looking man, wearing a tiara.

name: radbert
text: I think the clock demonstrates time passing, but Ray in his state has his own version of time, probably during which he's not sure if he's real.

name: apmihal
text:
Dammit I wish it was like that for me. When I get high all I get is the munchies and a panic attack...

I know, its pitiful.

name: xi
text: Two great things that aren't simply "L@@K INTO YOUR PAST": Teodor's speech-bubble is actually behind his head, because it doesn't matter what he is saying - Ray is talking about CAMPING. Also. How great is it that you can always hear the dialogue in your head, spot-on, as it should sound? Talent. Pure unbridled. How else could you laugh for so fucking long at a line like "I'm gonna go into the garage and smell metal stuff. Instead."?

name: usversusthem
text: It's strips like this that make me wish it was possible to "Rate this Strip:" a six.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Onstad: We made paella.

name: i_love_kate
text:
"My dog looked at me with her eyes."

Heh. Classic Onstad.

name: tekende
text:
Onstad jerked a chicken.

Heh. Classic bestiality.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: The chicken had it coming.

name: gournal
text: It wouldn't have been wearing those low-rise jeans if it didn't want it.

name: deusoma
text: God DAMN does this bring back good memories. Memories of eating massive amounts of salted peanuts while becoming completely entranced by a news program in a language I didn't understand because the anchor had a kickass beard.

name: imbattin
text: Going camping in the middle of your own party isn't completely rude, only partially.

name: unsentletter
text: Just that you've got to let your people know about the shift of venue.  That's all.

name: almightygosh
text: Yeahhhhhhhhhhhhhhh!

name: mattylite
text: Just another on the long list of achewood punctuation gems: the period before "Instead."

name: atticusonline
text: Ray...is that...are you smoking heated up marijuana?!

name: yukinomiko
text:
"You can't go camping in the middle of your party. That's kind of rude."

*Dotted Line Ray*

I'm not sure why, but the dotted lines make me giggle every time.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: That's where Ray splits, Time stops, and he goes off Grid. lalalalalala.

name: all-star951
text:
The clock appeared briefly in the fifth panel, then disappeared.
((it would have showed up behind the speech bubble in the first panel))

Also, it appears to only have 12-3 o'clock. Is this a by-product of Ray's stoned-ness?

name: atypicaloracle
text: ... damn, that is some potent herb that cat has smoked...

name: hungryhippo1492
text: Well, My mind has been blown.

name: kiltedkaboodle
text: I've only been close to this high after smoking God's gift mixed with purple kush. What the hell did Ray get buzzed on?

name: jar
text: Ray temporarily turns invisible from embarrassment.

name: samspud
text: The clock is a stopwatch. It is there, in Ray's stoned mind, indicating 15 seconds. It is not expressed physically.
